description: Cache recently accessed inventories in localStorage for quick access from home page

userStories.title: useRecentInventories Hook
userStories.description: Create a React hook that manages recently accessed inventories in localStorage
acceptanceCriteria: RecentInventory type: { slug: string, name: string, lastAccessed: number }
Hook returns: recentInventories array, addRecent fn, removeRecent fn, clearAll fn
addRecent(slug, name) adds/updates entry and moves to front of list
List capped at 10 items (oldest removed when exceeding)

userStories.title: RecentInventoriesList Component
userStories.description: Component to display list of recent inventories with click to navigate and remove button
acceptanceCriteria: Each item shows: inventory name, relative time (e.g. '2 hours ago'), X remove button
X button calls onRemove(slug) with event.stopPropagation()
If inventories array is empty, render null (don't show section)
Styled with Tailwind matching existing card/list patterns

userStories.title: Integrate with Home Page
userStories.description: Add RecentInventoriesList to Home page above the slug input
acceptanceCriteria: Import useRecentInventories and RecentInventoriesList in Home.tsx
Show RecentInventoriesList above the 'Access an inventory' section
Add 'Recent Inventories' heading when list is non-empty
Section hidden when no recent inventories (clean for new users)

userStories.title: Track Access in Inventory Page
userStories.description: Call addRecent when user successfully accesses an inventory
acceptanceCriteria: Call addRecent(slug, inventory.name) when inventory data loads successfully
Only call when isAuthenticated and inventory data exists
Use useEffect to trigger on inventory load
Test: access inventory → go home → see it in recents → click → returns to inventory
